Once you walked through the gateway and the blushing White Cell guard, you officially entered the outskirts of Dashville proper. The town itself resembles an organic version of Los Pegasus. Another pegasus friend has once sent you a postcard from the city so you had some ideas of what it looks like. Like its real life counterpart, the tall buildings around downtown are built in the ancient Pegasi-style; their elongated columns and domed roofing made from clouds are some of the most beautiful examples of pony architecture you've seen. The only difference here is the fact that they're made from a combination opaque membranes and cartilages (for structural support). Imagine a cloud city 20 times the size of Cloudsdale and it will give you a rough idea of the size of Los Pegasus. Dashville seems to even exceed that. My...a fully-functioning city right here in Rainbow Dash... Big Mac's nothing close to this. They even got parks and a river made from liquid rainbows. Goodness, how many things is Dash capable of producing with all this?!, you mentally exclaimed.

“Ah...No matter how may times I stepped into this city, Dashville is always so beautiful,” Rainbow Cell reminisced, “Come on! Let's get going!”

Your guide smiled and flew ahead of you, leaving you to catch up with her.

“Hey! Slow down there! Humans can't fly, you know.”

'Well, I'm so used to doing this. I think you're the one who needs some adjusting here,” the pegasus smirked, “Catch ya later!”

With that, Rainbow Cell flew off.

You focused your eyes on the flying pegasus as she weaved through the sky, which is light pink in color; there are even wisps of clouds dotting random spots above which adds to the great mystery of this city. The nearest destination from the city entrance is the Rainbow Streams Park. Rainbow Cell landed beside the sign marking the entrance to the park and motioned for you to follow her. When you entered the park, you noticed that almost all of the ponies in here are copies are Rainbow Dash; a sea of rainbow manes is all that you could see. Like your guide told you, there are unicorn and earth pony versions of Dash relaxing and playing around, engaging in all sorts of recreational activities you'd see in Canterlot Park on a sunny weekend. Much to your astonishment, there are also “families”; a male and female Dash with several adorable fillies and colts versions of Dash running and laughing around. Despite being identical to their 'master', it seems that there are still subtle differences in their manestyles and supposed personality. As an example, you saw one reading an organic-looking book underneath the shade of a “tree” (which looks more like something you would find in a lung) and another doing loops in midair like a hyperactive filly. One of them kept her mane long and flowing while another had it in a mohawk.

Before you could do further analysis of your new environment, a male voice suddenly interrupted your thoughts.

"Hey, Dash! Long time no see. How's your work at “Fantasy Fulfillment” doing lately?”

The source of the voice is a male Rainbow Cell a few feet in front of you two. He's wearing a safety helmet and a uniform with a wing lapel pin on it. The pegasus has the same coat and eye color as the real Rainbow Dash, but he kept his mane brushed up in a spiked fashion.

“Well, nothing much. Just more news about the 'master's' estrus getting out of control and I having to fulfill every one of those thoughts despite how much I hate it. I bet that “Flights and Wing Maintenance” is doing much better for you.”

“Sad to hear that! The Cells running “Estrus Management” and “Self Control” department just can't seem to put their differences aside and just had to ruin it for everycell here,” the male pony said.

“Yeah. It's no use arguing with those foals...,” Rainbow Cell laments.

Wow! Who's that you're bringing with you?"

“Oh, this is a human librarian. This guy here got here by the way of another estrus victim due to the competition at the aforementioned departments,” Rainbow Cell scowled.

“Another victim? So fast? I thought that the 'master' is done with humans already. My...he looks absolutely awful. He really needs some patching up.”

“That's precisely what I'm going to do.”

I see...Anyway, weIcome to Dashville. I'm Rainbow Cell #8347932 but you can call me Blazer for convenience,” Blazer said while shaking your hand with his hoof.

“Nice to meet you,” you nodded.

“You're really lucky that she found you, human guest. Rainbow Cell #0974564 here is a very caring cell, you see. Feel free to call her Dashie if you feel like it.”

“Blazer! I though we're though with discussing my nickname!”

“But it sounds better than a string of numbers, Dashie,” Blazer smiled.

“That's none of your business. If you got nothing important to say, I haven't got all day with you. Bye!”

Rainbow Cell (you are calling her that for now lest 'Dashie' incurs her wrath) dragged you away from the stallion and led you out of the park and onto the streets where even more cells are flying around.

“Just ignore that guy, human. He's a former coworker who loves to pull jokes on me,” R. Cell said.

For the rest of the way, the both of you remained silent. A few turns down the block, you reached a low-rise building marked: T. Cumulus Building.

“Here we are, 2132 Cirrus Lane,” R. Cell announced as she led you inside.

Rainbow Cell's home is on the 5th floor of the building. A ride in a spherical elevator, the designated floor is reached and a wall appeared in the front. R. Cell tapped her hoof on the wall in a specific pattern like some sort of password and the wall opened immediately, showing her home for you to see.

Her home is vastly different from the organic world outside. It neither big nor small but very comfortable-looking. It's looks like the typical apartment in any of the cities in Equestria. The kitchen is right by the doorway but it's furnished with appliances and equipments you've never seen before. The living room is colorfully decorated: the couch and the tables are all rainbow-colored while the "carpeting" is cerulean. A large rectangular mirror is placed opposite of the couch. That's a really strange place to put a mirror. Many recruitment posters from a "Elite Rainbow Corps" is pasted on the walls. From the look of the slogans: Only the Best Cells Gets In, you guessed that it's some inner-body counterpart of the Wonderbolts. Another hole allows you to look into her bedroom, which is designed to mimic the surface of clouds and the colors of the sky. A picture of Rainbow Dash in her victorious posture is hung prominently in an alcove in the wall.

Rainbow Cell led you to the couch and motioned for you to have a seat.

"Welcome to my humble home, human. It's Anything I could get you?"

142232211211111.title: The Town and Rainbow Cell's Home

1422322112111111.content:
You had your questions about... virtually everything, why the departments are so fixated about competitions instead of mutual cooperation. They are more like rivals, enemies perhaps? Dash say that it caused imbalance to her stamina.

"Ok," you started, "While I was in Big Mac, his body was almost like a living city. Rather than a body with each organs acting like facilities, living apartments and so on. Here in Rainbow Dash, it's like another world entirely, I mean, Big Mac doesn't have this kind of city or even inhabitants! Yes, I saw some cells that looks like him but not in populated areas like this functioning city. Are there more cities like Dashville in here?"

She seem to ponder in what you asked her. "Yes... there is Teatbeach, as you can guess, it's in Rainbow's teats. It's a beautiful vacation town where everycell can enjoy drinking and swim of our master's milk. It's nutritious and delicious, especially during her season. Livertown is in the liver, obviously. It is mostly a working town where most of the cell-ponies there are involved in the creation of new enzymes for the stomach, sugar's mining, and the creation of other chemicals to maintain the body. There is El Pulmon, which is in the lungs, where you can enjoy gambling, shopping and the wild nightlife, and where the Rainbow Corps live. And finally, there is the Head City, all the departments are there, also where the Dash Council is based. There is a rumor that our own master knows about us and have an avatar of her acting as queen.. but that's only a rumor and I find a quite silly if you ask me. There are other small towns all across Rainbow's body, for example we missed one that was in the womb's tubes, Foaltown, they have evacuated I think."

"Intriguing... what about the Dashes cells here, are all like the real dash?" you asked. Dash looked at you unamused, in fact, a little insulted.

"What? Is there something wrong?" you asked.

"Do I look like an arrogant, brash, hotheaded fool that goes around seeking every opportunity for cheap greatness?" she snapped.

"No no...I'm sorry if I offended you and-"

"Nah, it's okay... actually, that's a really common question from foreign cells that lives in our master's body. Sorry if I snapped; every cells in here gets a little affected by the 'master.' As for your question about the personalities of the cells, each Rainbow Cell have a very different and unique personality, some changed their coat to another color and even adopt new names but in order to still be Rainbow Cell, you at least need to leave your mane multicolored," she answered while you nodded.

"That brings to mind another question: what do most of the foreign cells do in here? I presume that most of the works in here are already occupied by the Rainbow Cells."

"That's easy. They are given the right to live in Dash's body under the condition that they do not cause any harm to it or any other cells. They will be placed under the constant watch of the White Cells to root out any viruses or beings that intend to wreak havocs. Any violations of the terms would mean arrest and interrogation by the Rainbow Corps and sentence varying from lengthy community services in the Colon to outright expulsion. As for the jobs they do, the foreign cells have the opportunity to join any of the work associations in all parts of the body or participate in the various departments as advisers. Though, for obvious reasons, 'Leading Adviser' is the highest position they can attain."

"With all this economic activities going on, is there some kind of currency system used in here?"

"There is the Dashcoin which is basically the same thing as the Equestrian bits. Yeah, I know how unoriginal that name is. But don't blame me, tell that to the Dash Council. They're the one calling the crappy shots around here. I just happen to read a lot about the outside world."

"Fascinating , but the million-bits (or Dashcoin) question remains unanswered: why won't the departments cooperate with each other? It's really counterproductive and a threat to the integrity of Rainbow Dash if you ask me."

"No pony knows when the rivalry started. Some said that it's because of Rainbow Dash personalities, who are the owners of each department are in a very complicate relationship, Anger, lust, Love, Happiness, Pride, intelligence. All of the Personalities blame each other for lacking Common Sense. Since then, they don't get along well. As a consequence of this, each department's cells developed a dislike of their rivals over the years, they have become unstable and are affecting our master herself."

"That explains Rainbow's constant erratic behavior and mood swings. It absolutely made her a trainwreck of a pony at times if the rumors flying around Ponyville are to be believed. There must be some ways I can help," you said, There has to be some ways to improve Dash's performance.

"Unfortunately no. As I told you before, they won't listen to you. They won't even listen to my complaints for goodness sake. You're just another weak outsider in their eyes and if you provoke them, the worst thing that will happen to you is being condemned to the Intestines Prison, bladder expulsion, or worse, the stomach execution lake, or exile through estrus activities. "

"Is it possible to talk with one of them, or at least convince a small minority about their shortcomings?" you asked.

"Maybe... Lust Dash and Love Dash. The "Sister" are the only one that have a good relationship, they own the Estrus and Love Departments as well "Fantasy Fulfillment. They usually go to Teatbeach for vacation to escape the usually stressful brain office. Love Dash is dating Shy Dash, while Lust have her hooves on Anger and Pride. Intelligence, happiness and Sadness are at odds with the sisters but you can start with them, they "enjoy" meeting new cells" she finished, I hope this new information clears up a lot of things. All you need to do is to talk with them and convince the other personalities to work together, that's will probably change the views of the departments at each other.

That's some good news.

"But don't count too much on that. Lust and Love can be a little imposing and arrogant at times. But if you stay on their good sides, you're generally safe."

You nodded in acknowledgment. An abrupt growl from your stomach made you blush as Dash giggled like a filly while rolling on the floor.

"You must be starving right now. That reminds me, I'm eating out today at my favorite restaurant, my treat. Rainbow Dash is probably still napping and having whatever weird stuffs the Dreams Entertainment is playing for her. It'll be hours before she wakes up and cell activities increase. Let's use this time to get the best at the restaurant. It'll get real crowded at regular time."

Dash headed for the exit.

"Hey wait up there, Dash. Where exactly are we going? Back at The Rainboom?" you ask

"Nope. We're going to Brae's Waterhole."
1422322112111111.title: More Questions [REVISED]

14223221121111111.content:
Brae's Waterhole is situated on the crossroad between Hurricane Blvd and Firefly Rd, a few blocks down from Dash's apartment. In stark contrast to its surrounding, the establishment was designed with the feel and aesthetic of a hearty, South Equestrian restaurant. That region tends to be on the rural, undeveloped side but the farm ponies there made up for that with their hospitality. You guessed that the owner is likely a foreign cell given that Rainbow Dash was born in Cloudsdale. The faux-wooden boardings and timber construction of the building quickly catches your attention. A large billboard placed on the roof of the structure proudly advertised in bold capital letters:

BRAE'S WATERHOLE
A Western Taste for Everycell

Dash led you through a set of wooden doors into the restaurant. The atmosphere immediately reminds you of a barn. Wood barrels, troughs, and the oil lamps on the wood tables welcomed and immersed you in their rustic simplicity. A few other cells are slowly gathering in as it approached dinner time. You and Dash found a table and sat down on the bales of hay which doubles as the seats. As the servers were busy managing the other tables, Dash started to talk with you.

"This here is my favorite spot, mage," Dash said proudly, "You get a nice view of almost all the tables in the restaurant and, most of all, the diners. Unlike others who just focused on their foods, I just love to see all the different cells coming and leaving through the doors and wonder about which department they're working in or what were their thoughts when they trotted to their table. It's just an interesting way to observe you own surrounding."

"I did the same thing pretty often back outside. What do you think about the cells around you?"

"Frankly, I think a good half of them are either average at best or outright boring at worst. Many of them supported the competition among the departments without thinking for the long term. They believed that division would create a stronger cell population and maintain the status quo, which they love to euphemistically say as 'that's what makes Rainbow Dash Rainbow Dash.' There are a few bright spots like me around the body but they are gradually being outnumbered."

"Sad to see the jerks slowly taking over the rational cells here. All it takes is a few idiots to ruin it for everyone."

"I'd use stronger expressions if we weren't in a public area," Dash remarked.

You wanted to continue your conversation with Dash but you were interrupted by a yellow earth pony trotted over to the side of the table. He is wearing a large Stetson upon his golden-brown mane and a brown vest covered his body. The stallion has a large red apple for a cutie mark.

"Hi, Dash. Welcome to the Waterhole. Pleasure to have your company again. What can I get you on this fine afternoon, miss?" he greeted with a southeastern accent.

"I'll just have the usual, Brae," Dash replied with a smile.

"Sure. I saved some of your favorites: enzyme burger with a side of mitochondria salad and an iced glucose tea. Wow! And I see you even a brought a friend here. Always nice to know new guys around here! Might I have the pleasure of knowing who he is?"

"You see, Brae. This guy over here is a human librarian I found in the Rainbow Dash's womb. He told me that he was doing "anatomy research" in a stallion when our 'master' unfortunately found the pony an easy target under the control of her estrus-crazed mind. This human was unfortunately sent in here with the rest of the stallion's contents."

"Ow! I'm so sorry to hear about that. I know how bad RD could be in her heat. If it weren't for you, Miss Dash, I'd probably be a goner now. Dash's body is nothing like the old one I'm from but I'm getting quite used to seeing all the different Rainbow Cells 'round here. Sadly, though, I never found out what she did to my 'master' after being sent down here. I just wish I could give that mare a piece of my mind!" Brae shook his head.

"No need to mention that, Brae! I think we can all agree that some serious changes to Rainbow Dash is needed," Dash concurred.

The mare turned her attention to you.

"Sorry to leave you out of the loop, human. This nice-looking cell here is Braeburn. But he prefers to be called Brae. He's the owner of this place and one of the better known foreign cells."

"Pleasure to meet you, Brae," you offered your hands to the stallion.

"Same here," he said as he offered his hoof.

"Nice restaurant you have here. The atmosphere in here is certainly a nice diversion from the outside," you complimented.

"Thanks a lot!" Brae smiled, "South Equestria has a lot more to offer than the city folks tends to think."

"Might I ask how did you end up here in Rainbow Dash, anyway?" you asked.

Brae's expression immediately became uncomfortable at the topic.

"Shhhh...Don't ask about that? He just recently recovered from the trauma! Dash whispered hushly, He got in here about a year ago when Rainbow Dash found and played with his 'master' one night in a town called Appleloosa. I'll leave out the details of how he got transmitted here for sake of your sanity. Let's just called it unconventional methods. I found this poor guy stranded in the Colon barely conscious. I couldn't just watch another cell get hurt like that so I brought him to my place and nursed him back to health. But, to my surprise, Brae here is a really resilient fella. After rehabilitating for a month or so, he decided to open up this restaurant as a way to remember his old home."

"I must apologize, Brae. I didn't know that," you said.

"It's alright. A lot of the cells here asked me that same thing. You won't be the last one to have asked that question," the stallion smiled and returned to a cheerful demeanor.

"Ever since his place opened up, Brae provided us Rainbow Cells with a refreshing change from the bland foods they serve at our sorry excuse for a cafeteria. After a year, virtually everycell in town is talking about his restaurant," Dash continued.

"Oh shucks! I'm flattered, Miss Dash! That's nothing, I'm just doing what I love here and that is satisfying the appetites of everycell," Brae blushed, "Oh, I almost forgot. What can I get for your human friend here?"

An expression of realization struck Dash's face.

"Ummm.....," she wondered for a while, "Ummmm...Brae, could you please get the menu for us?" the mare asked with an awkward expression.

"Sure, absolutely. I'll be right back with one, Miss Dash. Just sit tight!"

Brae trotted away to another corner in the restaurant and disappeared behind a set of doors. Once Dash made sure that the coast was clear, she turned back to you with a sheepish grin.

"What exactly do you cell eat here?" you whispered to Dash.

"Heh...heh....Have you ever tried lipid fries, baked sphingomyelin pies, or peptide drinks before?"

"......." you stared at her with an incredulous expression.

Oh, well. I guess it's time for you to try out some awesome new food," Dash smirked mischievously.

1511.title: Pinkie Pie.

15111.content:
The party pony's acid is colored bright pink which makes it look like fruit punch. Although invulnerable to digestion, you still feel a slight ticklish sensation. It was a comfortable place to be. The warm, pouch-like enclosure of the stomach gently shook as Pinkie Pie trotted over to the oven to retrieve a tray of freshly baked cookies. The pony lifted the tray and placed the fragrant treats into a glass jar on the counter. "Mmmmm...The cookies sure looks good today," she said as she tried one. Pinkie then went about rearranging the cupcakes and assorted pastries under the display case while humming a little tune to herself.

Back in the stomach, you swam around the acid for some times before deciding that you had enough and found a dry area to stand on. You rested on the soft bouncy floor and looked up at the opening of the esophagus releasing more chewed pieces of cookies and cakes. Listening to Pinkie humming so happily really soothes your mind. That pony always seem cheerful and lovely no matter the time and situation. At least that is what other residents of Ponyville told you. As the minutes flew by, you got bored of guessing what Pinkie will be eating next so you stood up and take a look around. A few puddles away, you located another opening in the stomach wall. Normally, you wouldn't pay much attention to such little things but you counted two openings in the stomach. If one leads to the intestines, where does this one go?

You curiously walked toward the opening and found a flight of stairs for you to climb. You slowly tread up the steps wary of anything that might come your way. The stairs led up into a fancy-looking lobby filled with streamers and colorful furniture. A large banner with "Pinkie Pie Welcomes You" written in silly lettering hung from the ceiling. Several other banners are colored in bright pink and blue. In the center of the lobby, much to your surprise, a gleeful looking Pinkie was rushing toward you with a big grin on her face. You were knocked down by the sheer force she propelled herself into you.

"Oh my gosh...oh my gosh...oh my gosh...I can't believe I have a visitor in here. Hi there, I'm Pinkie Pie and how did you get here?" the party pony smiled.

"Ummm... I'm–"

"Wait, Lemme guess. Are you a parasprite?"

"No."

"What about a bakery fairy?"

"No."

"A changeling?"

"No, Pinkie."

"Or maybe....you're a spy who infiltrated my body?" Pinkie suddenly sounded stern.

"No! I'm a human mage who mastered the shrinking spell which allows me to explore a pony's inner body. And I must say that you are the weirdest one I've seen yet," you explained.

"You're a human mage?! Woo-hoo, I just got the first visitor in my body and it's a human! So awesome!"

"Wait, how exactly can you be in your own body?"

"I have no idea," Pinkie chimed, "I guess that I just do it. I just have to think real hard and this happens."

"....."

Come on, mage. I need to give a proper "Welcome to Pinkie's Body Party!"

"This Pinkie Pie definitely isn't an ordinary mare." you thought

151231.content:
The Trek on the tunnel for you was a little claustrophobic, the muscles and walls touching you and push you in, the humid darkness was a bit overwhelming but by the time you go more further, the tunnel expand giving you more space to walk, of course there is still the moist and fluids coming from the walls but it' wasn't a problem anymore, there is certaily a little illumination now.

"You are close..." You saw an sphincer-like entrance at the end,. "Here, this is my rooms, when my Husband, Pinkie and the Twins were in me during that time, each room I designed to be unique, the pony or person who concentrate at the magick orb in the room." it open revealing an medium sized spherical room, it was empty but in the center you saw an pink orb glowing, hovering, you can feel magic from it, something that isn't possible in a earth pony, then again, all ponies have form of innate magic in their bodies, unicorns are the only one of the subspecies that can harness the magic from their bodies.

"What is this?" you question, getting closed to the pink orb the magic was more... raw yet refined, this was Earth Pony magic?

"This is my magic, Earth ponies have magic too, Daerie, I'm no a unicorn or know much about magic, but this is the result of Princess Twilight's spell, this is how my magic looks like now, influence by my thoughts alone, I can make create anything in me thanks this orb of my magic"

I find it a little impossible to do that, Mrs. Cake, it would take grand quatities of magic to transform it into objects, while I can feel this orb's magic being raw, is still small to create anything necesary for a room to live" You stated but then you feel the orb start to glow with untaped intensity, soon it flash a blinding light, forcing you to close your eyes, when opening you could not believe was were you seeing.

the room... changed.

There was a bed, no an organic bed, but an actual bed, an table, booksheft with cook books, history, novels, photos of twins and the store and a clock in it, a lamp and more. your mouth hanging in the display by the single orb that hover in front of you.

"That... that's... Impossible! how?!" You exclaim still trying to process what just happened in this room, somehow earth pony magic just made what an archmage or 3 highly advanced unicorns could do and more. this was the power of a single orb?

"I told you Daerie, This is the effect of Twilight's Spell, the spell transform a pony into a living home, this spell was also to eradicate viruses where normal medicine could not cure, further modification the spell made the host to able to modify his or her body to be literaly a living home, some found use it more use for the host to become a refugee home in the past wars even unforgiving living prisons." you heard her talk, it was almost straight from a lesson, a spell book or an magician but is could be logical that she learned the spell that affected her, possibly from the Princess of the town.

"Wow... so this how the spell effected your inner magic? it make sense for a spell of that kind of nature." you look impressed, everything from the bed to the books and clocks are real the real thing, no just organic like the rest of Dazzle's body.

"Yes Daerie, now, I think we can discuss a little agreement, You see, I was about to have Pinkie or Twilight to help me with a inner problem." she say a little unconfortable, you notice a little unease tone in her voice, this is something that she don't like to discuss it seems.

"What kind of trouble? are you hurt or sick?" you asked, this could prove useful and gain her trust, you plan to stay here for a little while.

"Oh no no no, Daerie, I want you to help me with my body and some of my organs. She say with a little of amusement and embarrassment, you're confused on what she said.

"what do you mean?" You ask, this is... a strange request, then again you are in a very unlikely place,

"I want modify some of my organs and it's additional function, I can't do this alone, I need as well to change some part of my bodies, like my teats" she finish, your eyes widen at the example.

"Your teats?" You ask surprised.

"Yes, since the twins birth, my teats still lactate and stop until a time, and I can't do much without another unicorn or somepony or someone capable in use magic, that's an example of one of the other parts of my body that I need help." she finish, you ponder in this revelation, you can gain her trust, and if things go smoothly maybe befriend her, she also mentioned other ponies that were affected by the spell, probarbly she could to those ponies as well.

"Alright, Mrs. Cake I accept, you tell me where to go."

"Thanks, Daerie for accept... aren't you tired?" she ask.

"Now that you mention yes, I'm a little drained with this kind of suprises.".

"Rest, mage, when you wake up, your first place you will go will be in my heart." you look kind of suprised, but nodded as you climb to the bed, looking for a small time to sleep, the sound of her organs and heart were relaxing pulling to sleep peacefully for few hours.

This is a Theory but I could have changed Mrs Cake into an Unicorn if it continue in effect, if that's correct I haven't discovered one spell but made an Unicorn Transformation spell too! this require further study.

Cup's blood cells seems to have a trance of my magic in it, transforming the bloodstream and dividing it into more smaller ones for the creation of tunnels and passages for possible habitants, before, Mr Cake, Pinkie as well the twins were inside of Cup Cake while she was still inexperienced, now I'm here providing her teaching for her new body's abilities while studying the effects, Pinkie is here to help me in my research, so far she's very excited in helping me"

You head toward to statue, wanting to take a closer look at this strange stone carving. As you get closer, you end up tripping over your own feet and crash into the statue, knocking it off its pedestal. You hear a loud crash when it impacts against the floor. You look over that see that the statue has been smashed to pieces. You scramble off the pillar and move beside the statue's remains, hoping that you could somehow fix it.

"I'm so sorry, Fluttershy! I promise that... I'll..." You felt that something was very wrong when you saw that light above the pillar changed from a light blue to blood red. In place the soft looking birdlike wings were sharp looking bat wings. While the face on the first statue had a kind looking smile, this one had seemed to hissing and sporting a sharp pair of fangs. The last thing you notice was that her mane was ragged looking and her ears were curved and jagged at the tips. “Fluttershy, why does this statue of you look li-” You stopped talking when you heard Fluttershy give a sick sound groan.

“Ugh… Mage, I don’t feel so good…” You’re really worried now, uncertain what your accident had done to Fluttershy.

***

Unbeknownst to you, Fluttershy’s body started to go through a radical change. Her wings were changing into batwings; her ears were changing shape and become more sensitive and two of her teeth had shifted into fangs. Her eyes soon snapped open, revealing that they were blood red.

***

“Oh no…” You heard Fluttershy speak again. “This is bad… this is very bad!”

“Fluttershy, speak to me! What’s going on? What can I do to help?”

“I just saw in a mirror, I’ve been turned into Flutterbat again!” She shouts out as her body start to shake, she must be on the move.

“Flutterbat? What’s Flutterbat?” You nervously scratch your arm as you question the frightened mare.

“It’s a long story, but the important thing right now is that I’m not in control of my body!” You can feel all the colour drain away from you face as the panicked mare speaks.

***

The bat mare was practically ransacking the kitchen, searching for the fruit that she was driven to eat. Finding none, she ran out the back of the house. She used her wing to shield her eyes from the setting sun. She was about to rush back into the house when she caught the scent of apples on the wind. Once she determined the direction that the delicious smell was coming from, she spread her wings and took off.

***

You tumble to the floor as Fluttershy’s body takes to the sky. You quickly get to your feet, despite the turbulence. “W-w-what’s happening?!”

“My body is now under control of a vampire fruit bat’s drive to find and eat fruits, specifically apples. I can’t control of my body anymore; I can see, hear and feel everything my body’s doing, but I can’t stop it.”

“I’m so sorry Fluttershy, this is all my fault. I just don’t get how breaking a statue could have caused this.”

“I think it may be somewhat of a metaphor or something that was made physical by the living fortress spell. The bat’s instincts and drives weren’t removed from me, but suppressed. Twilight’s spell made my mind the dominant one in my body again while the bat’s instincts were buried deep inside me and sealed away.”

“I guess that makes some sense, but I’ll admit that I’m really unfamiliar with all these different spells and the effect of them combining.” You briefly ponder, trying to come up with a possible solution. “Fluttershy, do you think that if I pushed the bat statue back down into the pillar, you would be in control again?” She remains silent for a moment as she considers your plan.
“I don’t think it’ll work unless you can repair the original statue. Can you do that?”

“I don’t think so. I learned how to repair flesh, not stone.” You then take a deep breath. “I still think that I should try to push the bat statue down. I think the worst case scenario would be it does nothing, so I think we should give it a try.”

“Alright, it does seem worth a shot. I just hope I don’t end up eating all the apples at Sweet Apple Acres…” You hop up onto the pillar and place your hands down on the statue’s snout and shoulder. As you push down, it does…

You followed the rainbow mare out of the bedroom and into a long hallway. It is very narrow with only several inches of space remaining on either side of you. The walls are covered with hard, plastic-like shells colored to match Dash's coat color. Dim lights are projected toward the arched ceiling which casts an even glow along the hallway.
